summary:
After obtaining my D.Sc. degree, I have spent 11 years in mineral exploration – Zimco Ltd. (Zambia); UNDP (Rwanda); Billiton (the Netherlands, Spain) – of which 4 years in a management position. Exploration during this period focused on base metals, nickel, tin, tungsten, coltan, rare earth minerals, gold and industrial minerals and covered all stages of mineral exploration, from grass roots to feasibility studies. 

In 1986 I joined ITC’s Department of Mineral Exploration, initially as Assistant Professor and, as from 1989, as Associate Professor.  In 1996 I joined ITC’s Bureau of Project Services (BPS) as a Senior Project Officer for 50% of my time and, at the same time, reducing my imput in teaching. In that dual function major tasks comprised acquisition, monitoring, supervision and implementation of consulting projects. 

I have been involved in the supervision and/or implementation of some 20 major consulting projects covering most countries of eastern and southern Africa (Sudan, Ethiopia, Tanzania, Uganda, Rwanda, Malawi, Zimbabwe, Mozambique, Namibia), South America (Brazil, Colombia and Surinam) and southern Asia (India and Bhutan). Projects ranged from grass roots exploration for alluvial gold (Surinam), to capacity building/institutional strengthening, to curriculum development, to a pre-feasibility study on rock phosphate for fertilizer production (Malawi). Lately, I have been involved in regional mapping projects (+ geodynamic analyses and regional mineral assessments), covering the Bicesero tin field in Rwanda, the Marmato gold field, Caldas, Colombia, Tigray, Ethiopia (40,000 km²), Rondonia, Brazil (240,000 km²), NW Tanzania (10,000 km²), Mozambique (440,000 km²) and Uganda (250,000 square km).

In 2005 I started my own one-man company “Westcourt GeoConsult”. This company builds on over 35 years of accrued experience gained in previous employments.

Specialties: - dedicated teacher in mineral exploration (Geology of Ore Deposits, Regional Metallogeny, Exploratrion Design and Project).
- Expert on Precambrian geology (southern and eastern Africa; Guiyana Shield, south America).
- Heavy Mineral expert (field and laboratory methods).
- Mapping Expert (modern digital mapping methods).
- Project acquisition, monitoring and management. Project evaluation.
- Curriculum development; Capacity Building.
